# Fight Health Insurance

> A Django application that helps patients appeal health insurance denials using AI-powered appeal letter generation.

Fight Health Insurance is a web application that assists users in generating persuasive appeal letters when their health insurance claims are denied. The system combines a modern web interface with machine learning integration to create effective appeals, supporting both synchronous and asynchronous workflows with WebSocket streaming for real-time generation.

## Core Features

- **Appeal Letter Generation**: AI-powered generation of persuasive appeal letters based on denial details
- **Multi-channel Delivery**: Send appeals via fax, or download as PDF
- **Real-time Streaming**: WebSocket-based streaming for long-running ML operations
- **Chat Interface**: AI-powered conversational assistance for appeal creation

## Project Structure

- [fighthealthinsurance/](fighthealthinsurance/): Main Django application
  - [views.py](fighthealthinsurance/views.py): Primary web view handlers
  - [rest_views.py](fighthealthinsurance/rest_views.py): REST API endpoints (DRF)
  - [common_view_logic.py](fighthealthinsurance/common_view_logic.py): Main business logic
  - [chat_interface.py](fighthealthinsurance/chat_interface.py): AI-powered chat assistance
  - [generate_appeal.py](fighthealthinsurance/generate_appeal.py): Appeal generation logic
  - [websockets.py](fighthealthinsurance/websockets.py): Django Channels WebSocket consumers connecting to appeal generation, chat interface, and entity extraction.
  - [models.py](fighthealthinsurance/models.py): Database models (~30+ with encrypted PII)
  - [ml/](fighthealthinsurance/ml/): ML integration layer
  - [forms/](fighthealthinsurance/forms/): Django forms
  - [templates/](fighthealthinsurance/templates/): Django templates
  - [static/js/](fighthealthinsurance/static/js/): React/TypeScript frontend
- [fhi_users/](fhi_users/): User management app
  - [models.py](fhi_users/models.py): PatientUser and ProfessionalUser models
- [charts/](charts/): Analytics and visualization
- [tests/](tests/): Test suites (async, sync, sync-actor, selenium)
- [scripts/](scripts/): Utility scripts

## API Endpoints

REST API endpoints are under `/ziggy/rest/` prefix with OpenAPI documentation via drf-spectacular.
